rComments: He couldn't care less about his students. After he entered the wrong grade for my midterm, I emailed him THREE times and he never followed through with fixing the error. I had to contact my TA at the last minute to get things sorted out. His lectures were mostly boring, too. However, if you come to class and do the readings, it's an easy A.

This is a very small seminar course, yet half of the people don't come to lectures. Professor Baigrie and Baines make the lectures so boring and drowsy by using poorly made slides and no classroom feedback. Despite writing a literture review and a long final paper, I still feel I learned nothing. Not to mention that only some slides are posted.

lecture is super monotoned, terrible use of visual or teaching aids. No one was actually listening to him, most people are just doing their own stuff. Never responds to emails, never reponds to student inquries, doesn't hold even one office hour for students to go and ask questions. This course is just horrible. Avoid at all cost!
The professor was really nice and enthusiastic. He has good understanding of the topic and was amazing at supporting his student!

Very understanding and caring Prof. The course material (written by him) was about $50, much cheaper than other courses. You'll need a TopHat subscription too, know that other UofT courses use it too. TopHat was also integrated well into the course where lecture slides were available to follow along during the lecture. A very interesting course!
Great sense of humour
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: If you could avoid taking his class, I would. What is on the slides vs what he verbally says does not match up AT ALL. He makes you buy Top Hat only to do weekly quizzes that can be done on Quercus. Dont even try emailing you, hell respond months later. Tests are fair if you studied; you can get a good mark just dont rely on him to get it

I learned this entire course through Googling the material myself, his slides are copy/pasted from his textbook that you must buy through TopHat and he is incredibly slow at responding to emails. A pity, the course material is not entirely uninteresting -- he just doesn't do a very good job talking about it.

Very dull lectures on very interesting content. Will often go on long, unrelated tangents, or entirely skip large portions of the slides. His textbook is poorly written and often confusing. He assigned "participation" questions (worth 25% in all) which are vague, confusing, and often unrelated to the given lecture slides.

Took the course 1-3 years ago (I didnt want to be identifiable). extremely vagueconsistent grading criteria. Told me an essay draft was very good, then gave me a 70. Does something that this sites rules dont allow me to claim. If you are ADHD/trouble writing notes, lecture is painful, recordings usually useless out of context.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lecture heavy', 'So many papers']

rComments: The entire course was not pleasant. There are no visual guides in class, the content felt like a mess and questions were based more on small keywords rather than actual understanding the bigger concepts. The textbook is extremely difficult to read, and have poor explanations.

-The reading he wants you to do, which are written by himself, is hard to understand. His sentence runs on and on and on, really un-concise writing. -He test things that are not even mentioned inside the assigned readings, as well things are not mentioned in his lectures. -Not worth the time.

Great lecturer, fun & engaging with the material - makes class enjoyable. Course materials are made available through TopHat, which was significantly cheaper than most of my other classes, you could view all the lecture slides, see the textbook and the reviews at the same time. Clear grading criteria, clear expectations, fair in class quizzes given

Utterly terrible lecturer. Course materials are only made available via a subscription service. Lectures have virtually zero focus, no visual aids available aside from Top Hat. Organisation of course is chaotic, and confused.

He assigns vague/misleading questions that must be completed before the end of class. The questions, which are worth 25% of your grade, are heavily weighted on correctness. Did I mention the questions were - as emphasised in the syllubus - intented to gauge participation? I guess I misunderstood the definition of a "participation" grade.
I really enjoyed Prof. Baigrie's classes. Thoughtfully organized, I always felt that we were getting a rich understanding of each paper before diving into a critical discussion.

Professor Baigrie is one of the wisest and most intelligent professors I have ever met. He offers fascinating critical analysis of the readings in class and encourages participation. I admit he takes some warming up to, as he can be pretty straightforward with his comments, but in this sense he treats you as not only a student, but as his equal.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: REQUIRES you to spend $$ to sign up for a service that needs all kinds of permissions on your phone for 15% of grade. The app sign-up REQUIRES you to buy temporary access to prof's text, though the course outline disingenuously states you will have the "opportunity" to pay for this.  Class just started and I am already very unhappy with this prof.
Deep analysis of difficult material.

used platform called tophat that required you to pay. it doubles as his visual aid, when he could just use powerpoints like a reguarl professor. tophat was a poor choice, confusing and hard to use. online reading was wordy.  required too many texts. lectures are boring
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Excellent course.  Knows his material.  Fair.

Amazing and inspiring lectures. You won't want to miss class. Readings are light-moderate but important. Pre-read or you will be lost in lecture. Intensely insightful.  Try to take his courses early in your degree so you can figure out if you want to take more with him later!

Professor Baigrie gives a course in which the lecture material does not matter. There are no tests but midterm and term papers that are pretty long. It is nevertheless very easy to get an A or B in the course because it is 25% participation. Baigrie is hilarious but often rude and picks on people.

Lectures were hit or miss even though the subject matter was interesting. He told jokes and made comments about students with accessibility needs that made me feel very uncomfortable, hinting that you'd have to be stupid to not do well or to take all the time in the test to finish. Not very professional. Would not take another class he taught.
Excellent prof!
Makes history come alive but u have to come prepared to work !
Terrific Course. Favourite professor!
Very knowledgeable.  Excited about course.
Course itself is very interesting, but prof is very disorganized and rude. Take this course but avoid him

Wonderful professor. Really knows his stuff and makes every lecture worth sitting through and quite funny. Don't really have to go to the lectures, course pack + wikipedia is usually enough although some small points are only given in lectures. This review would be the same for HPS210 (Part 1 of HPS2-). Very highly recommended course and professor.

Taught a course on the history of science without mentioning the contributions a single woman to the field. When this was mentioned, the subject was quickly glossed over. As well he refused to meet disability-related accommodations. He's likely a brilliant scholar, but doesn't appear to care much for students. At least outwardly.
In a class of 25 he didn't know most students' names by the end of the year. Also, his course material was garbage and a waste of time for any student going into the physical sciences.

Probably a good researcher and clearly an important asset to the university (he teaches from his own textbook), but completely useless for the education of the student. Thrice I attempted to get in touch with him to purchase the reader (which I could only do via him) and thrice he blew me off, leaving me no material to study for the midterm. Great.
Esoteric stuffs were taught in class. Good luck trying to read that thick course packet.
Best prof ever! Interesting stories and entertaining... better than the discovery channel.

Interesting to talk to and overall a good human being, but he told us once that he was burnt out and it shows. He does not always show up when you schedule appointments with him, and almost never receives or respond to emails that students send him. He just wanted to study Descartes and ended up teaching intro to logic for too many years.
Looking back at my entire undergrad experience, this guy may have been my Numero Uno. Engaging, hilarious with some of the most critical content out there - Highly Recommend.
His lectures are anything but sleepy.
A decent professor and, most importantly, a tarrific person!

He was kind of funny, but I found that going to the lectures was next to useless, since he would contradict points in lecture that he had made in the notes package.  My grade in the course came from reading the notes and supplementing it with some encyclopedia research on important topics.

I thought he was really engaging, and obviously cares about the subject matter he's teaching. Baigrie managed to keep a class that's a mix of science and humanities from favouring one or the other, which I liked. Despite the fact that he re-uses some tests, I still felt that the experience was really worthwhile.

Spent close to $200 in books he edited/published and they weren't really needed. He had a course book of his for $20 which was all anyone needed. A very nice prof, he just has to answer his email and create a course website! Same exams as previous years.
No Comments
Totally ineffective as a teacher. He manages to mystify every point of fact. He could screw up a cup of coffee.

Does he assume that students are all insanely stupid? Why must he give easy (predictable) exams on lectures that are pre-transcribed and available for $10? I don't call this a quality education. Has no interest in engaging with students whatsoever. Doesn't encourage deep or original thought--there are no essays. An insulting experience overall.

Entertaining because lectures like he's telling a story, doesn't over-complicate and keeps away from too much technical detail. Funny. Essays were marked easier than I had expected, tests were easy & fun (if you ever went to class/took notes)
not much to say...I did not like him as a prof. Not interesting...
Good professor. Makes lectures interesting and always good for a laugh. Don't expect him to ever show up to an appointment.
A great prof... if you enjoy being confused! Lectures are disorganized!
Awesome prof!  I also took a philosophy course just because he was teaching it.
Good prof, funny lectures but his jokes are usually relevant examples as well.  Never heard him mention any web page.
Take his class! Gives great lectures, and is genuinely interested in what he is teaching. Tests are fair; you won't be suprised during the exam. Great class.
Completely incompetent
Very conceited!!! Prefers to tell jokes than actually try to teach you something.  But hey, slackers get through somehow right?
good jokes, easy tests, full of himself and his crappy webpage
good jokes, easy tests, not that friendly 1-1
funny.. actually went to class to listen to his jokes
Very funny but rather conceited.  Boasts about his website too much.
Very funny guy.  You actually look forward to his lectures!
Awesome class. Surprisingly very interesting!
